documents.document: Watched a nervous female kangaroo pee on the nose of a male roo that got too friendly. You go, female roo!
The photoshoot with me and the kangaroos as objects was much cuter before that huge male roo joined us. Talk about ripped! 😳😰
I just had a mama roo hop by my office w/a joey in its pouch, and now I'm glued to the window, making high pitched squealing noises at them.
Did I say I had been at Stromlo for long enough to get used to the wildlife? Scratch that.
@RodogInfinite I still haven't seen Arrival! Have to get around to that at some point, because it sounds like I'd love it!
My officemate, ladies and gentlemen. https://t.co/rQDkL6X2SI
@philtastro Resistant mean, apparently. https://t.co/0y4qaGUYo1 I have heard/seen "cut mean", "robust mean" and "resistant mean" until now.
@philtastro I have found the implementation in IDL 😣 He won't allowed me to use that, though.
@philtastro Rob says an implementation definitely exists in Python, but I should read about it to understand caveats. Not finding anything 😔
You know you've been working at Stromlo for a while when you just brush off a warning message as "just another snake email".
@philtastro how do I MCMC a cut mean?
@philtastro when you can't find the method you're looking for, it gets particularly dry 😔
Sometimes your supervisor will ask you to implement something, and you'll end up on the office sofa, reading Numeri… https://t.co/ETcFfllTf6
Trust me. It's weird. And if you don't believe me, here is a comic for you that may just change your mind: https://t.co/rBOF7FIqjv
However, nothing seemed to mess up the brains of my fellow academic friends as me trying to explain the Danish counting system.
How some languages don't have tenses, so time doesn't exist, or how time in different languages can be either in front of or behind you.
How in some languages you use different words depending on your status, and the status of the person you are talking to.
Astronomers don't always talk about physics. Today during lunch we talked about linguistics. How languages shape our understanding of life.
I didn't know about these Apple features... https://t.co/GvvZdFrUd4
Make those cities more astronomy friendly! https://t.co/Soi7qDGzSE
@astrobonnie I LOVE THAT PEN! It's one of my favourites 😛
You know you're working, but then @FiPanther stops by your office to give you her drawings to colour in, because sh… https://t.co/xI4TyIDFEu
This little boy is onto something. I want Pluto to be a planet again, too. https://t.co/zTdjN5bkZJ
Sometimes you just need to put away your work for a few minutes to do some colouring. https://t.co/QTYmmYZhsH
Driving home after an unsuccessful observing night. At least I get to see some adorable joeys 😊 https://t.co/BG909A2tpH
@photonhandler @FiPanther I strongly approve of all of these! (Though broad lime region would be closer to my research)
@philtastro Yeah, you really wouldn't like to be in the Duffy basement. They are just about everywhere now.

Supervisor to @photonhandler: "Usually I'm in favour of learning to automate things, but not when it comes to IRAF."
Oh, IRAF.
"What are all those black dots down the corridor?" We went down to investigate. They were spiders. We share a corri… https://t.co/92Dugn2fn5
I feel like I have a few followers who may appreciate this. https://t.co/suVS7McjhW
This has been bothering me for years now. https://t.co/TY0aClk5nG
In the category "Things my supervisor tells me to make me feel better": You have gone from being a stupid undergrad to a stupid PhD student.
I have found the animal version of me. https://t.co/xNu2rcqsTl
Back to basics: Checking the software I use with data looking exactly like used in the demo of the program. https://t.co/vd1mjUoYSp
Knowing your own research can be a curse. WHAT DO YOU MEAN YOU DON'T AUTOMATICALLY KNOW ALL THE TINY DETAILS OF MY FIELD?? I'm confused!
Checking when the various planets rise tonight for a mate, because that's what an astronomer friend does!
@btucker22 I'm being told by @reggiekuruwita that it was 106.3, but neither of us remember much of the content. Just "yay, visitor centre".
Driving up to work, hearing an ad about @StromloANU Visitor Centre. Yay!
@photonhandler Yay! I'm happy you finally found him 😊
I'm not sure how I feel about The Big Gold Panner. He creeps me out a little. #TheBigTour https://t.co/qLfaSfEMDi
Went to #Young. Found The Big Cherries. Didn't buy any regular cherries for eating. #TheBigTour https://t.co/DVOoVen8xz

I swear the food was a bit better than it looks in the pic! The grass&dust made my allergies so bad, I couldn't act… https://t.co/cORQNtseyt
The Big #NedKelly in #Glenrowan. Only in #Straya. #TheBigTour https://t.co/E4NkBwumhw
We didn't even have this one on the list, but we found The Big Strawberry driving through #Koonoomoo. #TheBigTour https://t.co/4AH2cZHsk3
There is another Big Murray Cod in #Tocumwal. I tried to kiss it too. This one at least had kissy lips. #TheBigTour https://t.co/gu3UaZrKGg
I found The Big Murray Cod in Swan Hill. I tried to kiss it. It didn't kiss me back. #TheBigTour https://t.co/xyktTLIXV6

@Dilyar_B AT LEAST I KNOW HOW TO SPELL

Pretty sure the current big thing on #TheBigTour is what feels like a THOUSAND GINORMOUS BEETLES 😫

Btw, according to my calculations, it's ~23.5 minutes. Still don't think SA & NT should be 0.5 hrs offset from QLD, NSW, ACT & VIC, though.
.@Dilyar_B just had me calculate how much daylight we're gaining today by travelling west. Both love and hate that I felt the need to do it.
Aaand my last state/territory on the continental #Australia: #SouthAustralia! #TheBigTour https://t.co/QL3GPDlB1T
You know when you go to The Big Wool Bales in Hamilton, and @Dilyar_B decides to be super glam? #TheBigTour https://t.co/HfVDq8IBuS

Next on #TheBigTour: #TwelveApostles. I didn't count twelve of them. Oh well, guess I'll just have to come back! https://t.co/DtBioCpbeR

@DRG_physics Put it in a box first, then wrap the box 😊
@DRG_physics Scandinavians. What can I say. We're awesome 😛
@DRG_physics Oh my goodness, how great is that song ❤
Offered @Dilyar_B dinner. He starts typing frantically on his laptop. I look over, and see this... https://t.co/dLWFGJxGvJ
Hear, hear! https://t.co/0FT8JaHTsa
@FiPanther I know, right?!
Guys. This latter is completely possible. Look me in the eye and tell me I'm wrong. https://t.co/Vu6iabyR93
@FiPanther My impression is that hate and despise are acceptable in our field. It's just not as easy with positive(ish) feelings.
@FiPanther I don't understand why physicists love to hate it so much. I like it.
I very genuinely believed I was an observationalist. Now that I actually have to deal with observations myself, I miss theory just a bit.
My philosophy for today. https://t.co/pgF2lT2zos
This is the best use of magnetic poetry. I support this use of magnetic poetry. https://t.co/Wka6H00bGz
To the guy who let me have ice block for free tonight: Thank you! You made me feel just a little bit less worthless.
So do guys usually try to pick up chicks in the kid's section at Big W, or am I just the super lucky one?
It's probably because they kind of look like angry swans. And those beasts are floggin terrifying.
I don't seize to be baffled by how scary angry ducks are, considering how small they are.
Trying to write my thesis proposal, but realising I don't have any snacks. Send help (chocolate)!
You know when you find an envelope w/your name, & you get curious, & open it, & realise it's from the person you want to forget exists?

Dear baby roo:
You are cute and distracting. How about you hang out outside my window when I'm not freaking out ov… https://t.co/DoXqtb6fVq
The new #iOS #emoticons: Congrats on all the new gender representations and all, but OH MY GOODNESS, was that #clown really necessary??!
@DRG_physics You make me realise I have been living my life all wrong. This is what I should have been doing!!
@DRG_physics That's new -- I thought they just tricked dogs into water and proceeded to (try to) drown them.
So does everyone want to fight people when being told you are doing better, or is that just me?
As for all of you guys who keep eye contact with my nipples instead of me, yeah, nah, mate. Not gonna happen. Go away. Now.
And here's the thing, I let her poke my breasts. Because she wasn't creepy about it.
It was my housemate, who wanted to know what natural vs fake breasts feel like, and I could provide the natural ones.
